data.text: @dave_andersen What were you seeing in the cases by age data that looked odd yesterday? Is this the data you were looking at (obv updated today): https://t.co/UGi2oZx5m6 Also, do you know why the @wprdc total case number is off by 9 (using numbers from PA DOH, ACHD, and WPRDC from Friday)?
Something's odd with the Allegheny County cases-by-age data, so I'll get back to that once I've figured out what's up.

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16425 med/surg beds - 177 less than last Saturday, and back to expected levels after yesterday's blip. Hospital and ICU load from covid continues to drop very well; ICUs, in particular, are really starting to clear up, particularly in major metros

PA counties with full ICU beds:
Northumberland (2 +covid patients in ICU)
Clearfield (3)

Daily vaccinations didn't update today

Fully vaccinated in Allegheny County: 67.3% (state data), 48.9% of those are boosted.

Pennsylvania reports 1158 new cases.
Hospitalizations are -67 to 1089.
ICUs are -25 to 199 (80% full).
7 day avg drops to 1046-1075 cases/day
Transmission risk: Substantial

Today's results reflect 23895 new PCR test results https://t.co/oTI2VJV68m
